item.title: Report E-2023090303
item.description:
Report E-2023090303

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: ORANGE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 7, 2023, at 1800 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Orange, Texas regarding the release of approximately (15) gallons of f Gengard GN8123 (UN1760, 8, II) from (1) 55-gallon poly drum due to a load shift. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to a few pallets, and a 53’ x 8’ area on the trailer floor. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum, (1) overpack 95-gallon DF, and (1) supersack which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090195
item.description:
Report E-2023090195

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: ORANGE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 1, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon bucket of acetone was damaged during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES&H to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed that the released material evaporated prior to their arrival and there was no recoverable material remaining in the trailer. One (1) 5-gallon bucket of product was punctured and released all its contents. No other buckets were damaged and the crew determined it was safe for the driver to continue to his destination. The terminal manager indicated they would offload the freight there and repackage as needed.

item.title: Report X-2023081289
item.description:
Report X-2023081289

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was placed on IC cart for transport to Vanlines. Package was placed on its side instead of upright as depicted by directional arrows, then other items packed on top. Weight of additional packages caused seal on jug to pop, releasing approximately 16 ounces into carton, which caused the wet side to tear out, allowing jug to fall to floor, releasing and additional 10-12 ounces onto floor. DescribePack: Seal popped off top allowing material to be released from jug DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent mats were placed around spill to prevent spreading. Neutralizer was used to neutralize effects, absorb all used to absorb material so it could be cleaned up.

item.title: Report E-2023090332
item.description:
Report E-2023090332

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LGT experienced a 0.5-gallon release of UN1789 “Blue Whale Muriatic Acid” that was released from (1) 1-gallon poly jug. The release impacted the trailer as of result of a loose cap falling off during transit. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of material released from a 1-gallon poly jug impacting a 1’ x 1’ area on the trailer floor. Contractors collected the released product and damaged jug and containerized them into a 55-gallon and 5-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090193
item.description:
Report E-2023090193

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: AMARILLO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 30, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the concrete surface. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted surface. LSH personnel overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 85-gallon drum. The crew then deployed granular absorbents to the concrete and swept them in using hand tools. All spent absorbents and clean up debris were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The crew returned the next day to commence power washing procedures. A boom was deployed to contain the area while crews pressure washed. One hundred and fifty (150) gallons of paint-rinseate were collected into three (3) 55-gallon drums. One (1) drum of spent absorbents, boom, and cleanup debris was also generated as waste. All four (4) 55-gallon drums of waste were staged on-site for further handling by R+L personnel.

  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, a vehicle drove through the coned off delivery area and hit the hose adaptor. This caused the connection between the hose adaptor and storage tank to become compromised. Approximately 10 gallons of gasoline was released. The Harris County Hazmat team responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2023080932
item.description:
Report X-2023080932

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080932 SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scan at 0435 and left under rollers in the unload. At 5 when QA arrived, they were called to inspect the package in the unload. Upon inspection package was identified to be a HazMat. The cap of the inner item was loose and allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out. Cap was tightened, package was secured in a salvage drum and held at QA to be processed post sort. DescribePack: The inner item is a 2.5-gal plastic container that had a loose cap that allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out wetting the outer package. Top corner of the package is wet and appears to be tearing/coming apart. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA was made aware of the damaged item, they quickly responded to identify what the issue was and how to best resolve it. When it was identified as a damaged HazMat a salvage drum and container liner were retrieved to place the package in for safe keeping until it could be processed post sort. 2. X-2023080933 SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scan at 0331 and left under rollers in the unload. At 5 when QA arrived, they were called to inspect the package in the unload. Upon inspection package was identified to be a HazMat. The cap of the inner item was loose and allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out. Cap was tightened, package was secured in a salvage drum and held at QA to be processed post sort. DescribePack: The inner item is a 2.5-gal plastic container that had a loose cap that allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out wetting the outer package. One side of the packaging was completely wet and ripped/torn DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA was made aware of the damaged item, they quickly responded to identify what the issue was and how to best resolve it. When it was identified as a damaged HazMat a salvage drum and container liner were retrieved to place the package in for safe keeping until it could be processed post sort. 3. X-2023080935 SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scan at 0408 and left under rollers in the unload. At 5 when QA arrived, they were called to inspect the package in the unload. Upon inspection package was identified to be a HazMat. The cap of the inner item was loose and allowed some of its liquid contents to spill out. Cap was tightened, package was secured in a salvage drum and held at QA to be processed post sort. DescribePack: As soon as QA was made aware of the damaged item, they quickly responded to identify what the issue was and how to best resolve it. When it was identified as a damaged HazMat a salvage drum and container liner were retrieved to place the package in for safe keeping until it could be processed post sort. Top corner of the package by the FedEx label appears crushed and wet. Side of package has a wet stain and appears to be coming apart. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA was made aware of the damaged item, they quickly responded to identify what the issue wa

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat leak on door 13 in unload called out by area mnger it was leaking on top of another haz-mat ( a repack was done on it), i gathered my PPW blue gloves and lined red hazmat tote to present further spilling DescribePack: it appears as if the shipping box was crushed by another box, fell on its side and loosened the caps causing the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking haz mat was placed into lined hazmat tote

The spill was cleaned up, and the package was placed into a salvage drum. An amended shippers declaration was received and sent on to the consignee.
